intro: Amsinckia leptoclada, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Amsinckia leptoclada is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus.
